Specific Details: Minister Coveney TD attended Annual Dinner of the Engineers Ireland Cork Regional branch.
DPOs Lobbied: Simon Coveney|Minister|Department of Housing, Planning and Local Government::Seamus McGrath|Councillor|Cork County Council::Des Cahill|Councillor|Cork City Council
Subject Matter: Minister Coveney TD attended Annual Dinner of the Engineers Ireland Cork Regional branch.
Intended Results: For Minister Coveney to address the voluntary members and guests of Engineers Ireland's Cork Region and for the Minister to hear the views of members in relation to issues such as infrastructure and the importance of investing in engineering education at 3rd level.
Lobbying Activities: Letter issued to the Minister on the 3 January for the event dinner in Cork on 10 February 2017.  Event was held in the Maryborough Hotel, Cork.|Event / Reception|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Chairman of the Cork Region of Engineers Ireland, Michael O’Donovan.

Specific Details: Engineers Ireland Cork Regional branch Meeting
DPOs Lobbied: Seamus McGrath|Councillor|Cork County Council
Subject Matter: Engineers Ireland Cork Regional branch Meeting
Intended Results: Invitation issued to, and accepted by, Mayor of the County of Cork to attend the inaugural meeting of the 2017 - 2018 session of the Cork Regional branch of Engineers Ireland.  Aim was to inform the Mayor of the work of the Regional branch of voluntary members.
Lobbying Activities: This meeting (inaugural meeting for the 2017-2018 session of Engineers Ireland Cork Regional branch) was held at County Hall, 24 April 2017.  Invite to the Mayor Seamus McGrath, was issued by Kate Lehane, Chairperson of our Cork Regional branch.|Event / Reception|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Kate Lehane, Chairperson, Cork Regional Branch. Engineers Ireland.

Specific Details: Meeting with Councillors regarding Economic Development
DPOs Lobbied: Seamus McGrath|Councillor|Cork County Council::Deirdre O'Brien|Councillor|Cork County Council::Audrey Buckley|Councillor|Cork County Council::Nelius Cotter|Councillor|Cork County Council::Ann Marie Ahern|Councillor|Cork County Council::Frank O'Flynn|Councillor|Cork County Council::Gearóid Murphy|Councillor|Cork County Council::Gillian Coughlan|Councillor|Cork County Council::Ian Doyle|Councillor|Cork County Council::Michael Looney|Councillor|Cork County Council::Pat Hayes|Councillor|Cork County Council::Patrick Mulcahy|Councillor|Cork County Council::Sheila O’Callaghan|Councillor|Cork County Council
Subject Matter: Meeting with Councillors regarding Economic Development
Intended Results: To discuss and advance Cork Chamber's members' priorities regarding economic development in County Cork in a meeting with Fianna Fáil Councillors on Cork County Council.
Lobbying Activities: Meeting with Fianna Fáil Councillors on Cork County Council on 14th October 2024 in Cork County Hall to discuss business priorities for County Cork and current issues affecting economic development in the region, such as talent, skills and competitiveness. |Meeting|1

Specific Details: Gwen O'Donoghue emailed Michael McGrath, European Commissioner for Democracy, Justice and rule of law to invite him to attend a Gift of Life Ball in the Radissson Blu Hotel on Friday 15th Nov 2024 and copied Seamus McGrath..
DPOs Lobbied: Seamus McGrath|Councillor|Cork County Council::Michael McGrath|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Gwen O'Donoghue emailed Michael McGrath, European Commissioner for Democracy, Justice and rule of law to invite him to attend a Gift of Life Ball in the Radissson Blu Hotel on Friday 15th Nov 2024 and copied Seamus McGrath..
Intended Results: For Michael McGrath to attend the Gift of Life Ball in aid of organ donors in the Radisson Blu Hotel on Friday 15th November. Michael McGrath sent his apologies as he was not free to attend.
Lobbying Activities: Gwen O'Donoghue emailed Michael McGrath and copied Seamus McGrath. Michael McGrath responded with his apologies as he was not free to attend.  |Email|2-5

Specific Details: Meeting with Councillors regarding Transport in County Cork
DPOs Lobbied: Seamus McGrath|Councillor|Cork County Council::Deirdre O'Brien|Councillor|Cork County Council::Audrey Buckley|Councillor|Cork County Council::Nelius Cotter|Councillor|Cork County Council::Ann Marie Ahern|Councillor|Cork County Council::Frank O'Flynn|Councillor|Cork County Council::Gearóid Murphy|Councillor|Cork County Council::Gillian Coughlan|Councillor|Cork County Council::Ian Doyle|Councillor|Cork County Council::Michael Looney|Councillor|Cork County Council::Pat Hayes|Councillor|Cork County Council::Patrick Mulcahy|Councillor|Cork County Council::Sheila O’Callaghan|Councillor|Cork County Council
Subject Matter: Meeting with Councillors regarding Transport in County Cork
Intended Results: To exchange views and progress priorities in the area of transport development in County Cork in a meeting with Fianna Fáil Councillors on Cork County Council.
Lobbying Activities: Meeting with Fianna Fáil Councillors on Cork County Council on 14th October 2024 in Cork County Hall to issues related to transport in County Cork, including priority roads projects, such as the R624, the M28 and the M20, as well as public transport priorities, like BusConnects and Cork commuter rail. |Meeting|1
